titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Thomas Dolan Collection of Telegraph Messages
1861-1863
MS 173

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:46:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: Thomas Dolan collection of telegraph messages
did.abstract: A collection of about 275 individual telegraph messages dating from 1861-1863 sent out by telegrapher Thomas Dolan. The materials in this collection have been digitized and are available online to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via EBSCOhost.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in this collection are in English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in five folders; the individual telegrams are arranged alphabetically by author within the first four.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Thomas Dolan Collection of Telegraph Messages, MS 173, The New-York Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of approximately 275 individual messages sent out by Thomas Dolan, a soldier in the Union Army acting as telegrapher. The messages were written by various officers of the Union Army and others, listed here with the number of telegrams from each:

Abercrombie, Brig. Gen. J.J.:1
Ayres, Brig. Gen. R.B.: 1
Benhams, Brig. Gen. H.W.: 1
Berry, Brig. Gen. H.G.: 1
Biddle, Col. Chapman: 1
Bowman, Col. S.: 1
Brooks, Brig. Gen. W.T.H.: 2
Burnside, Maj. Gen. A.E.: 9
Butterfield, Maj. Gen. Daniel: 7
Casey, Brig. Gen. S.: 1
Colburn, A.A.G. A.V.: 8
Conkling, Roscoe: 1
Cooke, Gen. P. St. George: 1
Couch, Brig. Gen. D.N.: 6
Davidson, Brig. Gen. J.W.: 2
Franklin, Brig. Gen. W.B.: 2
Geary, Brig. Gen. John W.: 3

Humphreys, Brig. Gen. Andrew A.: 2
Kane, Brig. Gen. Thomas L.: 2

Marcy, Gen. Randolph B.: 2
McCarter, Col. J.M: 1
McClellan, Maj. Gen. George B.: 24
McDowell, Maj. Gen. Irvin: 1

Meredith, Brig. Gen. Sullivan A.: 1
Morell, Maj. Gen. Geo. W.: 1
Morton, Gov. O.P.: 1
Owens, Gen.:1

Porter, Maj. Gen. Fitz John: 103
Revere, Jr., Capt. Wm. H.: 2
Reynolds, Brig. Gen. John F.: 11
Richardson, Gen. J.B.: 1
Richmond, Asst. Adjt. Gen. Lewis: 2
Sickles, Brig. Gen. Daniel E.: 3
Sigel, Maj. Gen. Franz: 2
Slocum, Maj. Gen. H.W.: 2
Smith, Maj. Gen. Wm. F.: 3
Stoneman, Maj. Gen. George: 1
Sumner, Brig. Gen. Edwin Vose: 9
Sykes, Brig. Gen. George: 5
Tyler, Brig. Gen. R.O.: 1
Wainwright, Col. C.S.: 1
Webb, Lt. Col, Alex: 4
Wilkeson, Samuel: 1
Willcox, Brig. Gen.: 1
Williams, Brig. Gen.: S.2

The collection also includes the text of 51 messages sent or received on May 4 and 5, 1863, relating to the battle of Chancellorsville, written out and identified by sender on 12 pages. Included are messages sent by:

Babcock: 1
Barslow: 1
Benham, Brig. Gen. R.W.: 1
Butterfield, J.H.: 8
Clements: 1
Gibbons, John: 1
Hall, J.S.: 1
Hooker, Joseph: 4
Hunt, H.J.: 1
James, Lt. J.J:. 2
Jerome, A.B.: 3
Lincoln, A.: 1
Lowe: 1
Marcy: 1
McClellan: 1
Oliver, Paul A.: 1
Owen, Brig. Gen. J.: 1
Patrick M.R.: 1
Peck, Maj. Gen.: 1
Pierce, L.N.: 2
Powell, Richard: 1
Sedgwick, Maj. Gen. John: 6
Taylor: 1
Van Allen, Brig. Gen. J.H.: 2
Warren, Brig. Gen G.K.: 2
Williams, S.: 3
Zill, Rankin: 1
The materials in this collection have been digitized and are available online to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via EBSCOhost.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
The materials in this collection have been digitized and are available online to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via EBSCOhost.

did.unittitle: Text of telegrams to various recipients
